related_items.title: The flying statesmen
description: 1 drawing : crayon, ink brush, and opaque white ; 48.6 x 38.5 cm. (sheet) | World War II editorial cartoon shows a battered man with a globe head rejoicing as four men (labeled "F.D.R., Churchill, Stalin, [and] Chiang") fly over on a flying carpet.  In 1943, Roosevelt and Churchill met Chinese leader Chiang Kai Shek for the first time in Cairo to plan strategy.  Roosevelt and Churchill then flew on to Teheran for another historic first meeting with Soviet leader Joseph Stalin.  Duffy views this as an encouraging event for the Allies.

related_items.title: Photographs of Palestine, Jordan, Syria, Egypt, and Iraq
description: 334 photographic prints  ; 8 x 11 cm or smaller. | Photographs include: LOT 13759-1. "Jerusalem": Jewish, Christian, and Muslim  religious sites; LOT 13759-2. "New Jerusalem": commercial and recreational buildings, including Barclay's Bank, Y.M.C.A., and King David Hotel; LOT 13759-3. "The city  gates, Jerusalem": gates of Jerusalem; LOT 13759-4. "Church of the Holy Sepulchre, Jerusalem": exterior and interior views; LOT 13759-5. "Stations of the Cross on the Via Dolorosa, Jerusalem"; LOT 13759-6. "Garden and basilica of  Gethsemane (Church of All Nations), Jerusalem": including mosaics and dome; LOT 13759-7. "The Western Hill "Mount Zion": including Church of St. Peter, Church of the Dormition, Tomb of David and Coenaculum; LOT 13759-8. "Bethlehem": landscapes, street life, Church of the Nativity, and manger; LOT 13759-9. "Ain Karem (Reputed birthplace of St. John the Baptist)": interior and exterior views of religious buildings; LOT 13759-10. "Jericho, Jordan, and the Dead Sea": countryside, religious sites, man floating while reading in Dead Sea and aerial views; LOT 13759-11. "Transjordan, Es-Salt, Jerash, Amman, Petra": archaeological sites, camels, King Abdullah of Transjordan; LOT 13759-12. "Sea of Galilee,": fishing and scenes on the shores; LOT 13759-13. "Tiberas, Lido and the southern shore": aerial views, towns, and lake activities; LOT 13759-14. "Nazareth, Including Mount Tabor and Cana of Galilee": street life, countryside, Church and Grotto of the Annunciation, other religious sites; LOT 13759-15. "Haifa,  Mount Carmel": cityscapes, landscapes, commercial district, net fishing; LOT 13759-16. "Jaffa, Ramleh, Lydda on The Plain of Sharon": urban scenes, coastal views, aerial views; LOT 13759-17. "Tel-Aviv": shoreline and urban scenes; LOT 13759-18. "Jewish agricultural settlements, the Plain of Sharon and Esdraelon (Emek) (Centers of Zionist Agricultural Activities)": chickens, beehives, and farming activities; LOT 13759-19. "Orange cluture [i.e. culture] on the Plain of Sharon": oranges, workers, processing and shipping; LOT 13759-20. "Picturesque types of Palestine": agricultural, domestic, and social activities; LOT 13759-21. "Palestine flowers and fruits"; LOT 13759-22. "Syria and Lebanon,  "Beirut, Damascus, Mt. Hermon, Cedars": aerial views of urban scenes, camels, and snow covered landscape; LOT 13759-23. "Iraq, Comprehensive series touching various districts":  urban life, river scenes, the Great Mosque at Kadiman, other religious sites of ancient times, camels crossing Euphrates on a pontoon bridge and oil production; LOT 13759-24. "Egypt I Cairo (City)": urban scenes with emphasis on religious Islamic sites, palace of King Fuad I, Nile River; LOT 13759-25. "Egypt II Cairo (Pyramids and Sphinx)"; LOT 13759-26. "Egypt III Cairo (The Museum)":  mummy, Tutankhamen's statue, coffins, mask and throne; also canopic shrine; LOT 13759-27. "Egypt IV Port Said, Ismailia, Alexandria, and country scenes": statues, lake and canal scenes, picking cotton near the Nile; LOT 13759-28. "Babylon, Ur, and the River Euphrates": archaeological sites, people filling containers at water's edge, camels  crossing pontoon bridge at Kufa.

related_items.title: Aerial photographs of the Middle East
description: 24 photographic prints : gelatin silver ; 17 x 23 cm. | Predominately aerial photographs showing villages, cities, coastlines, rivers, harbors, deserts and other geographic features primarily in Jordan, Iraq, and Egypt.  Also shown are bridges, airports, biplanes, and flying boats (seaplanes).  Locations include the Pyramids at Jīzah (Gizeh), the Suez Canal, Alexandria, the Nile Valley, and Cairo in Egypt; the Gaza Aerodome, the Gulf of Akaba (Aqaba), Baghdad, Iraq, and the ancient of city of Petra in Jordan, and Buṣrá al-Shām in Syria. Albert I, King of Belgium in an airplane is also shown.

related_items.title: Photographs of Palestine, Lebanon, and Iraq
description: 57 photographic prints : gelatin silver ; 13 x 18 cm. or smaller. | Photographs show women at American University, Beirut (nos. 1-6); the tomb of the crusader d'Aubigny in the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, Jerusalem; street scenes, possibly in Tel Aviv, Greek(?) manuscripts and icons, portraits of Sir Winden, an electric cable in Jerusalem, April 1929 (no. 28), antique Roman glass, flooded streets ca. 1914, possibly in Jaffa, (nos. 46-53), Tiberias, a mobile ophthalmic clinic, textiles in the Armenian Church of St. James, Jerusalem; Caesarea, Lydda Airport, and a bridge and bazaar in Iraq.

rights:
The Library of Congress provides access to these materials for educational and research purposes and makes no warranty with regard to their use for other purposes. The written permission of the copyright owners and/or holders of other rights (such as publicity and/or privacy rights) is required for distribution, reproduction, or other use of protected items beyond that allowed by fair use or other statutory exemptions. There may be content that is protected as "works for hire" (copyright held by the party that commissioned the original work) and/or under the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations.  Responsibility for making an independent legal assessment of an item and securing any necessary permissions ultimately rests with persons desiring to use the item. See Legal Notices and Privacy and Publicity Rights for additional information and restrictions.

The Library of Congress would like to learn more about these materials and to hear from individuals or institutions having any additional information. Please contact us through our Ask A Librarian service.

Preferred Citation

Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information:
Frontline Diplomacy, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

Permissions

Items included in this collection with the permission of rights holders are listed below. For further use or reproduction of those items contact the rightsholders listed.

Interview of William W. Lehfeldt by William Burr, April 29, 1987, made available here with permission from The Foundation for Iranian Studies, 4343 Montgomery Avenue, Suite 200, Bethesda, MD 20814.

Interview of John S. Service by Rosemary Levinson, 1977, made available here with permission from The Regional Oral History Office, 486 The Bancroft Library, University of California, Berkeley, Berkeley, California 94720-6000.

Oral history interviews conducted by Mrs. Ann Miller Morin (below), made available here with permission from Mrs. Ann Miller Morin, 3330 North Leisure World Blvd., Apt. 808, Silver Spring, MD 20906.

  • Interview of Anne Cox Chambers, October 23, 1985
  • Interview of Jane Abell Coon, November 4, 1986
  • Interview of Betty Crites Dillon, December 9, 1987
  • Interview of Ruth Lewis Farkas, October 24, 1985
  • Interview of Rosemary Lucas Ginn, October 28, 1997
  • Interview of Constance Ray Harvey, 1988
  • Interview of Mari-Luci Jaramillo, February 21, 1987
  • Interview of Jeane Jordan Kirkpatrick, May 28, 1987
  • Interview of Caroline Clendening Laise, May 8, 1985
  • Interview of Claire Boothe Luce, September 19, 1986               
  • Interview of Mary Seymour Olmsted, June 25, 1985
  • Interview of Nancy Ostrander, May 14, 1986
  • Interview of Rozanne L. Ridgway, March 18, 1987
  • Interview of Mabel Murphy Smythe, May 2, 1986
  • Interview of Margaret Joy Tibbetts, May 28, 1985
  • Interview of Melissa Foelsh Wells, March 27, 1984
  • Interview of Faith Ryan Whittlesey, December 7, 1988

These 17 interviews are part of the collection on deposit in the Sophia Smith Collection External.
